DOW.description: Executive branch department responsible for national security and the armed forces. Renamed from Department of Defense (DOD) by executive order in September 2025.

DOD.description: Former name of the Department of War. Renamed to DOW by executive order in September 2025. Originally established as the Department of War in 1789, renamed to Department of Defense in 1947.

DOJ.description: Federal executive department responsible for enforcement of federal law and administration of justice.

DOS.description: Executive branch department responsible for foreign affairs and diplomacy.

DOT.description: Federal department responsible for the national transportation system.

DOE.description: Federal department responsible for energy policy, nuclear safety, and scientific research.

DOL.description: Federal department responsible for occupational safety, labor standards, and employment services.

DOI.description: Federal department responsible for managing federal lands and natural resources.

DOC.description: Federal department promoting economic growth, job creation, and trade.

USDA.description: Federal department responsible for food, agriculture, and rural development policy.

HHS.full: Department of Health and Human Services
HHS.description: Federal department responsible for protecting the health of Americans and providing essential human services.

HUD.full: Department of Housing and Urban Development
HUD.description: Federal department responsible for housing policy and community development.

DHS.description: Federal department responsible for public security, including border control, cybersecurity, and disaster response.

VA.description: Federal department providing benefits, healthcare, and services to military veterans.

ED.description: Federal department responsible for education policy and federal financial aid.

TREAS.description: Federal department responsible for fiscal policy, tax collection, and currency production.

GSA.description: Federal agency managing government buildings, procurement, and technology solutions.

OMB.description: EOP office responsible for the federal budget, regulatory oversight, and management of executive agencies.

OPM.description: Federal agency managing the civil service and federal workforce policies.

GAO.description: Legislative branch agency providing auditing, evaluation, and investigative services for Congress.

CBO.description: Legislative branch agency providing nonpartisan budget and economic analysis to Congress.

EPA.description: Independent agency responsible for environmental protection and public health.

NASA.description: Independent agency responsible for the civilian space program and aeronautics research.

NSF.description: Independent agency supporting fundamental research and education in science and engineering.

SBA.description: Federal agency supporting small businesses through loans, counseling, and contracting assistance.

SSA.description: Independent agency administering Social Security retirement, disability, and survivor benefits.

FEMA.description: DHS agency coordinating disaster preparedness, response, and recovery.

FBI.description: DOJ agency responsible for domestic intelligence and federal criminal investigations.

CIA.description: Independent agency responsible for foreign intelligence collection and analysis.

NSA.description: DOD agency responsible for signals intelligence and information assurance.

NIH.description: HHS agency and the primary federal agency for biomedical and public health research.

CDC.full: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
CDC.description: HHS agency responsible for public health and disease prevention.

FDA.description: HHS agency responsible for regulating food, drugs, medical devices, and cosmetics.

CMS.full: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
CMS.description: HHS agency administering Medicare, Medicaid, and the Health Insurance Marketplace.

FAA.description: DOT agency regulating civil aviation and managing U.S. airspace.

FCC.description: Independent agency regulating interstate and international communications.

FTC.description: Independent agency protecting consumers and promoting competition.

SEC.description: Independent agency regulating securities markets and protecting investors.

IRS.description: Treasury bureau responsible for federal tax collection and tax law enforcement.

CBP.description: DHS agency responsible for border security, immigration enforcement, and customs regulation.

ICE.description: DHS agency responsible for immigration enforcement and criminal investigations.

TSA.description: DHS agency responsible for security of U.S. transportation systems, especially airports.

USCIS.full: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services
USCIS.description: DHS agency administering immigration and naturalization services.

USPS.description: Independent agency operating the national postal service.

NIST.full: National Institute of Standards and Technology
NIST.description: DOC agency promoting measurement science, standards, and technology.

NOAA.description: DOC agency responsible for weather, oceans, and atmospheric science.

NRC.description: Independent agency regulating civilian use of nuclear materials.

USAID.full: United States Agency for International Development
USAID.description: Independent agency administering civilian foreign aid and development assistance.

DARPA.description: DOD agency responsible for development of emerging technologies for military use.

DISA.description: DOD agency providing IT and communications support to the military.

DLA.description: DOD agency providing supply chain and logistics support to the military.

DCSA.description: DOD agency responsible for security clearance investigations and industrial security.

CISA.description: DHS agency responsible for protecting critical infrastructure and cybersecurity.

EOP.description: Group of agencies that support the work of the President of the United States.

NSC.description: EOP forum for advising the President on national security and foreign policy.

NEC.description: EOP body coordinating domestic and international economic policy.

OSTP.full: Office of Science and Technology Policy
OSTP.description: EOP office advising the President on science, engineering, and technology policy.

USTR.full: Office of the United States Trade Representative
USTR.description: EOP office responsible for developing and coordinating U.S. trade policy.

CEQ.description: EOP office coordinating federal environmental efforts and NEPA implementation.

RFP.description: Formal solicitation document inviting vendors to submit proposals for a contract.

RFI.description: Pre-solicitation document gathering market intelligence from potential vendors.

RFQ.description: Solicitation document requesting price quotes for specific goods or services.

SOW.description: Document defining the specific tasks, deliverables, and timeline for a contract.

PWS.description: Contract document describing required results rather than specific methods.

SOO.description: High-level document outlining the overall objectives and desired outcomes of a contract.

IDIQ.description: Contract type providing for an indefinite quantity of supplies or services over a fixed period.

BPA.description: Simplified acquisition method for recurring purchases of supplies or services.

GWA.description: Acquisition vehicles available for use by all federal agencies.

GWAC.description: Pre-competed, multiple-award IDIQ contract for IT solutions available to all agencies.

FAR.description: Primary regulation governing federal procurement of goods and services.

DFARS.description: DOD supplement to the FAR with additional defense-specific procurement rules.

COTS.description: Commercially available products that can be purchased without modification.

GOTS.description: Software or technology developed by or for the government, available for reuse.

CO.description: Government official with authority to enter into, administer, and terminate contracts.

COR.description: Individual designated to assist the CO in managing contract performance.

COTR.description: Technical expert designated to monitor contractor performance on behalf of the CO.

KO.description: Alternate abbreviation for Contracting Officer, commonly used in DOD.

PM.description: Individual responsible for planning, executing, and closing a government program.

PO.description: Government official overseeing a specific project within a program.

GS.description: Pay scale for the majority of federal civilian employees, ranging from GS-1 to GS-15.

SES.description: Corps of senior federal leaders serving just below presidential appointees.

FTE.description: Unit of measure representing a full-time employee's workload (2,080 hours/year).

PII.description: Information that can be used to identify an individual, requiring protection under federal law.

PHI.description: Health information protected under HIPAA that identifies an individual.

HIPAA.full: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
HIPAA.description: Federal law establishing standards for protecting sensitive patient health information.

FISMA.description: Federal law requiring agencies to develop, document, and implement information security programs.

FOIA.description: Federal law granting the public right to request access to federal agency records.

NEPA.description: Federal law requiring environmental impact assessments for major federal actions.

FITARA.full: Federal Information Technology Acquisition Reform Act
FITARA.description: Law giving federal CIOs authority over IT spending and acquisition decisions.

ATO.description: Official authorization for an IT system to process information based on a security assessment.

FedRAMP.full: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program
FedRAMP.description: Government-wide program providing a standardized approach to cloud security assessment.

NIST SP.description: Series of publications providing technical guidelines and standards for federal IT systems.

RMF.description: NIST framework for integrating security and risk management into the system development lifecycle.

STIG.description: DOD configuration standard for securing information systems and software.

POA&M.description: Document identifying tasks needed to remediate security weaknesses in an IT system.

ISSO.description: Individual responsible for ensuring the security of an information system.

ISSM.description: Individual responsible for managing the security program for one or more information systems.

CIO.description: Senior executive responsible for IT strategy, systems, and information management.

CISO.description: Senior executive responsible for information security strategy and program.

CTO.description: Senior executive responsible for technology strategy and innovation.

CFO.description: Senior executive responsible for financial planning, reporting, and management.

CAO.description: Senior executive responsible for an agency's acquisition and procurement activities.

CHCO.description: Senior executive responsible for workforce planning and human resources management.

CDO.description: Senior executive responsible for data governance, analytics, and data-driven decision making.

SAM.description: Official government system for entity registration, contract data, and exclusions.

FPDS.description: Central repository of federal contracting data and procurement statistics.

USASpending.description: Official source for federal spending data, tracking awards and agency budgets.

MAX.description: OMB system for budget formulation, data collection, and collaboration across agencies.

CPARS.description: Government system for recording contractor past performance evaluations.

eSRS.description: System for reporting subcontracting plans and achievements on federal contracts.

DUNS.description: Unique nine-digit identifier for businesses, previously required for federal registration.

UEI.description: SAM-generated identifier replacing the DUNS number for federal entity registration.

NAICS.description: Standard system for classifying business establishments by type of economic activity.

PSC.description: Codes used to classify products and services purchased by federal agencies.

CAGE.description: Five-character identifier for entities doing business with the federal government.

DCAA.description: DOD agency providing audit and financial advisory services for defense contracts.

DCMA.description: DOD agency providing contract administration services for defense acquisitions.

SCA.description: Federal law requiring payment of prevailing wages on government service contracts.

DBA.description: Federal law requiring payment of prevailing wages on federally funded construction projects.

EO.description: Official directive from the President managing operations of the federal government.

FR.description: Official daily publication for rules, proposed rules, and notices from federal agencies.

CFR.description: Codification of all general and permanent rules published by federal agencies.

USC.description: Codification of federal statutory law organized by subject matter.

NDAA.description: Annual legislation authorizing defense spending and setting military policy.

FARA.description: Federal law requiring registration of agents representing foreign interests.

IG.description: Independent official responsible for auditing, investigating, and preventing waste and fraud.

OIG.description: Independent office within agencies responsible for oversight, audits, and investigations.

SDVOSB.description: Small business designation for firms owned by service-disabled veterans.

WOSB.description: Small business designation for firms owned and controlled by women.

HUBZone.description: SBA program for small businesses in economically distressed areas.

8(a).description: SBA program assisting small disadvantaged businesses compete in the marketplace.

SBIR.description: Competitive program encouraging small businesses to engage in federal R&D.

STTR.description: Program facilitating cooperative R&D between small businesses and research institutions.

LPTA.description: Source selection method awarding to the lowest-priced proposal meeting technical requirements.

BAFO.description: Final revision to a proposal requested during competitive negotiations.

CPAF.description: Contract type paying costs plus a fee based on periodic performance evaluations.

CPFF.description: Contract type paying allowable costs plus a fixed fee regardless of performance.

FFP.description: Contract type with a set price not subject to adjustment based on costs.

T&M.description: Contract type paying fixed hourly rates plus actual material costs.

OTA.description: Flexible contracting mechanism not subject to standard FAR requirements.

OCONUS.description: Geographic designation for locations outside the 48 contiguous U.S. states.

CONUS.description: Geographic designation for the 48 contiguous U.S. states and the District of Columbia.

PCS.description: Official relocation of a military member or federal employee to a new duty station.

TDY.description: Travel assignment at a location other than the employee's permanent duty station.

CAC.description: Standard identification and smart card for DOD personnel and contractors.

PIV.description: Federal smart card credential for physical and logical access to government systems.

HSPD-12.description: Policy requiring a common identification standard for federal employees and contractors.

IL.description: FedRAMP/DOD classification of cloud computing security requirements (IL2 through IL6).

JWICS.description: DOD's Top Secret/SCI network for intelligence community communications.

SIPRNet.description: DOD network for transmitting classified information up to the Secret level.

NIPRNet.description: DOD network for transmitting unclassified but sensitive information.

SCIF.description: Accredited room or building for processing classified intelligence information.

SCI.description: Classified information concerning intelligence sources, methods, and analytical processes.

TS.description: Security classification for information whose disclosure would cause exceptionally grave damage.

FOUO.description: Legacy designation for unclassified information requiring protection, replaced by CUI.

CUI.description: Unclassified information requiring safeguarding or dissemination controls per law or policy.

CMMC.description: DOD framework for assessing and certifying cybersecurity practices of defense contractors.

NARA.description: Independent agency responsible for preserving government and historical records.

GPO.description: Legislative branch agency producing and distributing official federal government publications.

CRS.description: Legislative branch agency providing nonpartisan policy analysis to Congress.

FLRA.description: Independent agency governing labor-management relations for federal employees.

MSPB.description: Independent agency protecting federal merit system principles and employee rights.

EEOC.description: Independent agency enforcing federal laws prohibiting employment discrimination.

OSHA.description: DOL agency ensuring safe and healthful working conditions through standards and enforcement.

BLS.description: DOL bureau providing economic and labor market data and statistics.

BLM.description: DOI bureau managing federal public lands and mineral resources.

NPS.description: DOI bureau managing national parks, monuments, and other conservation areas.

FWS.description: DOI bureau managing fish, wildlife, and natural habitats.

USGS.description: DOI bureau providing scientific information about natural hazards, resources, and ecosystems.

ATF.full: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives
ATF.description: DOJ bureau regulating firearms, explosives, arson, and alcohol/tobacco trafficking.

DEA.description: DOJ agency enforcing controlled substances laws and regulations.

BOP.description: DOJ agency responsible for the administration of the federal prison system.

USMS.description: DOJ agency providing security for the federal judiciary and apprehending fugitives.

ODNI.full: Office of the Director of National Intelligence
ODNI.description: Office overseeing and coordinating the U.S. Intelligence Community.

DIA.description: DOD agency providing military intelligence to warfighters and policymakers.

NGA.description: DOD agency providing geospatial intelligence and mapping support.

NRO.description: DOD agency designing, building, and operating reconnaissance satellites.

CYBERCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command directing cyberspace operations.

SOCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command overseeing special operations forces.

CENTCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for the Middle East and Central/South Asia.

EUCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for Europe and parts of Asia and Africa.

INDOPACOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for the Indo-Pacific region.

TRANSCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command providing global deployment and distribution.

STRATCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for strategic deterrence and nuclear operations.

NORTHCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for homeland defense of North America.

SOUTHCOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for Central and South America and the Caribbean.

AFRICOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for military operations in Africa.

SPACECOM.description: DOD unified combatant command responsible for space operations.

USSF.description: Military service branch responsible for space operations, under the Department of the Air Force.

USMC.description: Military service branch providing expeditionary and amphibious capabilities.

USN.description: Military service branch responsible for naval operations and maritime defense.

USAF.description: Military service branch responsible for air and space operations.

USA.description: Military service branch responsible for land-based military operations.

USCG.description: Military service branch responsible for maritime law enforcement and safety under DHS.

ACAT.description: DOD classification of acquisition programs based on cost and oversight requirements.

MDA.description: Official responsible for approving a DOD acquisition program at key decision points.

IOC.description: First achievement of the ability to employ a system in its intended operational environment.

FOC.description: Achievement of complete operational deployment of a system with all planned capabilities.

CONOPS.description: Document describing how a system or organization will operate in its intended environment.

CDR.description: Technical review evaluating the detailed design of a system before production.

PDR.description: Technical review evaluating the initial design approach of a system.

SRR.description: Technical review evaluating system requirements and their traceability.

PPBE.description: DOD resource allocation process for aligning budgets with strategic priorities.

POM.description: DOD document proposing total program resource requirements for the Future Years Defense Program.

FYDP.description: DOD document projecting forces, resources, and programs over a five-year period.

CR.description: Legislation providing temporary funding for government operations at prior-year levels.

DOGE.description: Government body focused on identifying and implementing efficiency improvements across federal agencies.

OGE.description: Independent agency providing ethics guidance and oversight for the executive branch.

OFCCP.full: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
OFCCP.description: DOL office enforcing equal employment opportunity requirements for federal contractors.

FEVS.description: Annual OPM survey measuring federal employee satisfaction and engagement.

TSP.description: Retirement savings and investment plan for federal employees and military members.

FEHB.description: Health insurance program for federal employees, retirees, and their dependents.

FEGLI.description: Life insurance program for federal employees and their eligible family members.

FERS.description: Retirement plan for federal employees hired after 1983, combining pension, TSP, and Social Security.

CSRS.description: Legacy retirement system for federal employees hired before 1984.

COLA.description: Annual adjustment to federal pay and benefits based on changes in the cost of living.

WIG.description: Periodic pay increase within a GS grade based on acceptable performance and time in grade.

SF.description: Government-wide forms prescribed by GSA for use across federal agencies.

DD.description: Official forms used within the Department of Defense.

OF.description: Government forms available for optional use by federal agencies.

MOA.description: Document establishing a mutual understanding between two or more parties.

MOU.description: Non-binding agreement describing the intentions and responsibilities of each party.

IAA.description: Agreement between federal agencies for the provision of goods or services.

ISA.description: Agreement governing the security requirements for connecting two information systems.

SLA.description: Agreement defining the expected level of service between a provider and customer.

PMO.description: Organizational unit overseeing the management of specific programs or projects.

IPT.description: Cross-functional team responsible for managing acquisition program development.

SME.description: Individual with deep knowledge or expertise in a specific topic or domain.

POC.description: Designated individual responsible for communication on a specific matter.

OPR.description: Organization or office designated as the lead for a specific task or program.

COCOM.description: Unified or specified military command with broad continuing missions.

JIAG.description: Senior legal officer in a military branch responsible for military justice.

UCMJ.description: Federal law establishing the military justice system for the armed forces.

SITREP.description: Periodic report providing a summary of the current situation in a specific area.

OPORD.description: Directive issued by a military commander detailing a planned operation.

FedBizOpps.description: Former website for posting federal contract opportunities, now merged into SAM.gov.

SAP.description: Streamlined procurement methods for purchases below the simplified acquisition threshold.

SAT.description: Dollar threshold below which simplified acquisition procedures may be used (currently $250K).

MPT.description: Dollar threshold below which purchase card acquisitions may be made ($10K for most agencies).

IGCE.description: Government's internal estimate of the cost for a planned acquisition.

QASP.description: Document describing how the government will evaluate contractor performance.

CLIN.description: Identifier for a specific item or service within a contract.

TO.description: Order issued against an IDIQ or other indefinite contract for specific work.

DO.description: Order for supplies placed against an existing contract or agreement.

GPC.description: Charge card used for simplified government purchasing of supplies and services.

OASIS.full: One Acquisition Solution for Integrated Services
OASIS.description: GSA GWAC providing complex professional services across multiple disciplines.

SEWP.description: NASA GWAC for commercial IT products, services, and solutions.

EIS.description: GSA contract vehicle for telecommunications and IT infrastructure services.

MAS.description: GSA long-term government-wide contracts providing commercial products and services.

BIC.description: OMB designation for government-wide contract solutions that meet criteria for value and management.

DCOI.description: OMB policy requiring agencies to optimize and consolidate federal data centers.

EIS2.description: Detailed document analyzing the environmental effects of a proposed federal action.

FONSI.description: Document stating that a proposed federal action will not significantly affect the environment.

EA.description: Brief analysis to determine whether a federal action requires a full environmental impact statement.

SBOM.description: Formal record of components and dependencies in a software application.

ZTA.description: Security model requiring verification for every user and device accessing resources.

CDM.description: CISA program providing tools and services for continuous monitoring of federal networks.

SOC.description: Centralized facility monitoring and responding to cybersecurity incidents.

CSIRT.description: Team responsible for responding to and managing cybersecurity incidents.

CONOPS2.description: Planning to ensure essential functions continue during and after a disruption.

BCA.description: Structured analysis justifying a proposed investment or project.

CBA.description: Systematic approach to evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of alternatives.

ROI.description: Financial metric measuring the profitability or efficiency of an investment.

KPI.description: Measurable value demonstrating how effectively objectives are being achieved.

OKR.description: Goal-setting framework linking objectives to measurable outcomes.

NACI.description: Background investigation required for federal positions of public trust.

SSBI.description: Comprehensive background investigation required for Top Secret security clearances.

SF-86.description: Standard form used to collect information for security clearance investigations.

SF-312.description: Agreement signed by individuals granted access to classified information.

DPAS.description: System ensuring timely availability of industrial resources for national defense.

ITAR.description: Regulations controlling the export and import of defense-related articles and services.

EAR.description: Regulations governing the export of dual-use and commercial items.

FedSIM.full: Federal Systems Integration and Management Center
FedSIM.description: GSA organization assisting agencies with IT acquisition planning and project management.

18F.description: GSA digital services consultancy helping agencies build user-centered technology.

USDS.description: EOP team using technology and design to improve government services.

TMF.description: GSA-managed fund providing agencies with financial resources for IT modernization.

DATA Act.description: Law requiring standardized federal spending data for public transparency.

OPEN Data Act.description: Law requiring federal agencies to publish data in machine-readable formats.

OMB A-11.description: OMB guidance on preparation and submission of federal budget estimates.

OMB A-76.description: OMB guidance on performance of commercial activities by federal agencies.

OMB A-123.description: OMB guidance on management's responsibility for internal controls.

OMB A-130.description: OMB guidance on managing information as a strategic resource.

FPRA.description: Agreement between the government and a contractor establishing billing rates for future contracts.

FPDS-NG.full: Federal Procurement Data System - Next Generation
FPDS-NG.description: Central repository of federal contracting data, successor to the original FPDS.

CPSR.description: Government review of a contractor's purchasing system for adequacy and compliance.

ESI.description: DOD program for enterprise-wide software license agreements to reduce IT costs.

PALT.description: Time from receipt of a procurement request to contract award.

OFPP.description: OMB office responsible for government-wide procurement policy guidance.

J&A.description: Document justifying the use of other than full and open competition in contracting.

DPAP.description: DOD office responsible for procurement and acquisition policy and oversight.

PNM.description: Document recording the principal elements of a negotiated contract action.

SSAC.description: Advisory body assisting the source selection authority in evaluating proposals.

SSA.description: Official responsible for making the final contract award decision in a source selection.

SSEB.description: Board responsible for evaluating proposals against stated evaluation criteria.

SSEP.description: Document describing the evaluation methodology for a competitive acquisition.

TINA.description: Federal law requiring contractors to submit certified cost or pricing data for large contracts.

DCAS.description: DOD function providing contract administration services for defense procurements.

CDRL.description: List specifying data deliverables required under a DOD contract.

DID.description: Document defining the format, content, and preparation instructions for a data deliverable.

WBS.description: Hierarchical decomposition of project work into manageable components.

IMS.description: Comprehensive schedule linking all tasks and milestones in a program.

IMP.description: Event-driven plan documenting program accomplishments and criteria for success.

EVM.description: Project management technique measuring project performance against planned scope, schedule, and cost.

EVMS.description: Management system implementing earned value principles for cost and schedule control.

CAS.description: Standards governing cost accounting practices for government contracts.

CASB.description: Board establishing cost accounting standards for defense and other government contracts.

ACO.description: Government official responsible for contract administration after award.

PCO.description: Government official responsible for the solicitation and award of contracts.

TCO.description: Government official responsible for negotiating and settling terminated contracts.

DCMC.description: Former DOD organization providing contract management services, now DCMA.

GFE.description: Equipment owned by the government and provided to a contractor for use on a contract.

GFP.description: Property owned by the government and provided to a contractor for contract performance.

GFI.description: Information or data provided by the government to a contractor for contract performance.

CPIF.description: Contract type paying costs plus a fee adjusted by a formula based on cost performance.

FPIF.description: Fixed-price contract with an incentive fee adjusted based on cost performance against a target.

FPI.description: Contract type combining a ceiling price with cost incentive adjustments.

FPLOE.description: Fixed-price contract requiring a specified level of effort over a stated time period.

DPAS-rating.full: Defense Priorities and Allocations System Rating
DPAS-rating.description: Priority rating assigned to defense contracts to ensure timely delivery of materials.

CICA.description: Federal law requiring full and open competition in government contracting.

FASA.description: Law simplifying federal acquisition procedures and promoting commercial item procurement.

FARA-acq.description: Law promoting efficiency and innovation in federal procurement processes.

SARA.description: Law improving the acquisition of services by the federal government.

OFPP-PL.description: Procurement policy guidance issued by the Office of Federal Procurement Policy.

PBA.description: Acquisition approach emphasizing measurable performance outcomes over prescribed methods.

PBSA.description: Service contracting approach focused on measurable outcomes and performance standards.

LCAT.description: Classification of labor types and skill levels used in service contracts.

ODC.description: Contract costs directly attributable to a contract but not labor, such as travel and materials.

G&A.description: Indirect cost pool covering general business expenses not tied to specific contracts.

OH.description: Indirect costs associated with supporting contract work, such as facilities and management.

WR.description: Hourly pay rate established for a specific labor category, often per SCA or DBA requirements.

WDOL.description: System providing prevailing wage rates for service and construction contracts.

APA.description: Federal law governing the process by which agencies develop and issue regulations.

PRA.description: Law requiring OMB approval before agencies collect information from the public.

GPRA.description: Law requiring agencies to set strategic goals, measure performance, and report results.

GPRAMA.description: Updated GPRA with enhanced requirements for performance planning and quarterly reporting.

GDA.description: Law establishing a framework for managing and sharing federal geospatial data.

FISAAA.description: Law amending the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act for electronic surveillance.

CFATS.description: DHS program regulating high-risk chemical facilities for security purposes.

REAL ID.description: Federal law setting minimum security standards for state-issued driver's licenses and IDs.

ESSA.description: Federal law governing K-12 public education, successor to No Child Left Behind.

FERPA.full: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act
FERPA.description: Federal law protecting the privacy of student education records.

IDEA.description: Federal law ensuring free appropriate public education for children with disabilities.

ADA.description: Federal law prohibiting discrimination against individuals with disabilities.

FLSA.description: Federal law establishing minimum wage, overtime pay, and child labor standards.

FMLA.description: Federal law entitling eligible employees to unpaid, job-protected leave.

ERISA.description: Federal law setting standards for private-sector employee benefit plans.

OIRA.full: Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs
OIRA.description: OMB office reviewing federal regulations and information collection requests.

NPRM.description: Federal Register notice announcing a proposed regulation and soliciting public comment.

ANPRM.description: Preliminary notice seeking public input before drafting a proposed regulation.

IFR.description: Rule that takes effect immediately but includes a comment period for potential revision.

RIA.description: Analysis of the costs and benefits of a proposed or final regulation.

CRA.description: Law allowing Congress to review and disapprove major federal regulations.

PL.description: Legislation that has been enacted by Congress and signed by the President.

HR.description: Legislative measure introduced in the U.S. House of Representatives.

SJ.description: Joint resolution introduced in the U.S. Senate requiring passage by both chambers.

HJ.description: Joint resolution introduced in the U.S. House requiring passage by both chambers.

SCOTUS.full: Supreme Court of the United States
SCOTUS.description: Highest court in the federal judiciary, with ultimate appellate jurisdiction.

POTUS.description: Head of state and commander-in-chief of the U.S. armed forces.

VPOTUS.full: Vice President of the United States
VPOTUS.description: Second-highest officer in the executive branch and president of the Senate.

FLOTUS.full: First Lady of the United States
FLOTUS.description: Title of the spouse of the President of the United States.

SECDEF.description: Head of the Department of War and principal defense policy adviser to the President.

SECSTATE.description: Head of the Department of State and chief foreign affairs adviser to the President.

DNI.description: Head of the U.S. Intelligence Community and principal intelligence adviser to the President.

CJCS.full: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
CJCS.description: Highest-ranking and most senior military officer and principal military adviser to the President.

JCS.description: Body of senior military leaders advising the President and Secretary of Defense on military matters.

SECNAV.description: Head of the Department of the Navy, overseeing the Navy and Marine Corps.

SECAF.description: Head of the Department of the Air Force, overseeing the Air Force and Space Force.

SECARMY.description: Head of the Department of the Army.

USD(AT&L).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition, Technology and Logistics
USD(AT&L).description: Former DOD position overseeing defense acquisition, now split into USD(A&S) and USD(R&E).

USD(A&S).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment
USD(A&S).description: DOD official responsible for acquisition and sustainment policy and oversight.

USD(R&E).full: Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering
USD(R&E).description: DOD official responsible for research, engineering, and technology development.

TRICARE.description: DOD health care program serving active duty members, retirees, and their families.

DHA.description: DOD agency managing the Military Health System and TRICARE.

DFAS.description: DOD agency providing finance and accounting services to the military.

PEO.description: Senior official managing a portfolio of related acquisition programs.

DAU.description: DOD institution providing education and training for the defense acquisition workforce.

DAWIA.description: Law establishing education, training, and career development for the defense acquisition workforce.

DoDI.description: DOD issuance providing specific procedures and implementing guidance.

DoDM.description: DOD issuance providing detailed procedures implementing DOD policy.

DoDD.description: DOD issuance establishing policy and assigning responsibilities.

MAIS.description: DOD information system with development costs exceeding specified thresholds.

MDAP.description: DOD acquisition program exceeding cost thresholds requiring milestone decision authority.

SAR.description: Congressionally mandated report on the status of major defense acquisition programs.

JCIDS.full: Joint Capabilities Integration and Development System
JCIDS.description: DOD process for identifying, assessing, and prioritizing joint military capabilities.

ICD.description: Document describing capability gaps and proposed solutions in the JCIDS process.

CDD.description: Document detailing operational performance requirements for a proposed system.

CPD.description: Document refining requirements for production of a proposed system.

FRP.description: Production phase following successful testing and Milestone C approval.

LRIP.description: Limited production before full rate production to verify manufacturing processes.

EMD.description: Acquisition phase developing and testing a system before production.

TMRR.description: Acquisition phase reducing technology and engineering risk before development.

MSA.description: Acquisition phase evaluating potential material solutions to satisfy capability needs.

MTA.description: Rapid acquisition pathway for prototyping and fielding capabilities within 5 years.

AAF.description: DOD framework providing multiple pathways for acquiring different types of capabilities.

DIB.description: Worldwide industrial complex providing products and services to the DOD.

FFRDC.full: Federally Funded Research and Development Center
FFRDC.description: Organization sponsored by a federal agency for long-term research and development.

UARC.description: DOD-sponsored research center at a university maintaining essential research capabilities.

SBSA.description: Acquisition restricted to eligible small business concerns.

VOSB.description: Small business designation for firms owned and controlled by veterans.

EDWOSB.description: Subcategory of WOSB for firms in industries underrepresented by women.

SDB.description: Small business owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals.

ANE.description: Alaska Native Corporation or tribal entity eligible for federal contracting preferences.

NHO.description: Organization eligible for sole-source and other contracting preferences.

GSA-IT70.description: Former GSA schedule for IT products and services, now consolidated into MAS.

ALLIANT.description: GSA GWAC for complex IT solutions, succeeded by Alliant 2 and Alliant 3.

POLARIS.description: GSA GWAC for IT solutions with pools for small business and HUBZone firms.

CIO-SP.full: Chief Information Officer - Solutions and Partners
CIO-SP.description: NIH GWAC for IT solutions and services available government-wide.

NITAAC.full: NIH Information Technology Acquisition and Assessment Center
NITAAC.description: NIH center managing government-wide IT acquisition contract vehicles.

BOA.description: Agreement establishing terms and clauses for future orders without obligating funds.

MATOC.description: IDIQ contract awarded to multiple contractors for task order competition.

SATOC.description: IDIQ contract awarded to a single contractor for issuing task orders.

MAC.description: Contract awarded to two or more vendors for the same or similar supplies or services.

NRFP.description: Formal notification by a vendor declining to submit a proposal to a solicitation.

LOI.description: Document expressing a party's intention to enter into a formal agreement.

NTP.description: Written notification authorizing a contractor to begin work on a contract.

NDA.description: Agreement to protect confidential information shared between parties.

OCI.description: Situation where a contractor's interests may compromise objectivity in government work.

DCIS.description: DOD IG criminal investigation arm investigating fraud and corruption.

AFOSI.full: Air Force Office of Special Investigations
AFOSI.description: Air Force agency conducting criminal and counterintelligence investigations.

CID.description: Army criminal investigation organization, now the Army Criminal Investigation Division.

NCIS.description: Navy civilian law enforcement agency investigating crimes affecting the Navy and Marine Corps.

ASBCA.full: Armed Services Board of Contract Appeals
ASBCA.description: Board adjudicating disputes between DOD contractors and the government.

CBCA.description: Board adjudicating contract disputes between civilian agency contractors and the government.

GAO-protest.description: Challenge to a federal contract award filed with the Government Accountability Office.

COFC.description: Federal court hearing monetary claims against the U.S. government, including bid protests.

AI.description: Computer systems performing tasks that typically require human intelligence.

ML.description: Subset of AI enabling systems to learn and improve from data without explicit programming.

RPA.description: Technology using software robots to automate repetitive business processes.

API.description: Set of protocols enabling different software applications to communicate with each other.

SaaS.description: Cloud computing model delivering software applications over the internet.

PaaS.description: Cloud computing model providing a platform for developing and deploying applications.

IaaS.description: Cloud computing model providing virtualized computing resources over the internet.

DevSecOps.description: Approach integrating security practices into the DevOps software development lifecycle.

CI/CD.description: Software development practice automating building, testing, and deploying code changes.

TIC.description: OMB initiative to consolidate and secure federal internet connections.

EINSTEIN.description: CISA system monitoring federal network traffic for malicious activity.

HSIN.description: DHS platform for sharing sensitive information across federal, state, and local partners.

CNSS.description: Interagency body setting policies for national security systems.

FIPS.description: Standards issued by NIST for use in non-military government computer systems.

SP 800-53.description: Catalog of security and privacy controls for federal information systems.

SP 800-171.description: Requirements for protecting CUI in nonfederal systems and organizations.

OSCAL.description: NIST framework for standardizing security assessment documentation in machine-readable formats.

CVE.description: System providing unique identifiers for publicly known cybersecurity vulnerabilities.

CVSS.description: Open framework for communicating the severity of software security vulnerabilities.

IR.description: Organized approach to addressing and managing cybersecurity incidents.

SSP.description: Document describing security controls and their implementation for an information system.

SAP-security.description: Document describing the methodology for assessing security controls of an information system.

SAR-security.description: Document reporting the results of a security control assessment.

PKI.description: Framework for managing digital certificates and encryption keys for secure communications.

DIACAP.full: DOD Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process
DIACAP.description: Former DOD process for certifying and accrediting information systems, replaced by RMF.

IAVA.description: DOD notification requiring immediate action to address critical cybersecurity vulnerabilities.

SORN.description: Federal Register notice describing a system of records maintained on individuals under the Privacy Act.

PIA.description: Analysis of how personally identifiable information is collected, used, and protected.

DPO.description: Official responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection laws and policies.

SAOP.description: Senior official responsible for privacy policy and compliance within a federal agency.

SAE.description: Official accountable for an agency's information governance and open data activities.

SPRS.description: DOD system for assessing contractor cybersecurity compliance and NIST 800-171 scores.

GSA-eBuy.description: Online RFQ system for ordering products and services from GSA schedules.

GSA Advantage.description: Online shopping system for federal buyers to purchase from GSA contracts.

COOP.description: Plan ensuring essential government functions continue during emergencies.

DEVGRU.description: Navy special operations unit, commonly known as SEAL Team Six.

JSOC.description: Joint command responsible for special operations missions.

SOFA.description: Agreement between the U.S. and a host country defining the legal status of military personnel.

NATO.description: Intergovernmental military alliance of North American and European countries.

FVEY.description: Intelligence alliance comprising the U.S., UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.

FMS.description: U.S. program for selling defense articles and services to foreign governments.

DSCA.description: DOD agency managing security cooperation and military assistance programs.

LOA.description: Document formalizing a foreign military sale between the U.S. and a foreign government.

FY.description: Federal government fiscal year running from October 1 to September 30.

MILCON.description: Construction, alteration, or improvement of military facilities.

BRAC.description: Process for reorganizing, closing, or realigning military installations.

POW.description: Military personnel captured and held by an enemy force during armed conflict.

MIA.description: Status of military personnel whose whereabouts are unknown after a military operation.

ROE.description: Directives defining the circumstances and limitations for the use of military force.

OPSEC.description: Process of protecting critical information from adversary observation and exploitation.

COMSEC.description: Measures to deny unauthorized access to telecommunications and information.

SIGINT.description: Intelligence gathered from electronic signals and communications.

HUMINT.description: Intelligence gathered from human sources through interpersonal contact.

GEOINT.description: Intelligence derived from the analysis of imagery and geospatial data.

MASINT.description: Intelligence obtained from scientific and technical analysis of physical phenomena.

OSINT.description: Intelligence collected from publicly available sources.

IMINT.description: Intelligence derived from the analysis of visual imagery from satellites and aircraft.

C2.description: Exercise of authority and direction by a commander over assigned forces.

C4ISR.full: Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance
C4ISR.description: Integrated system of systems supporting military command and decision-making.

ISR.description: Activities acquiring and processing information to support military decision-making.

UAS.description: Aircraft system operated without a human pilot on board.

CBRN.description: Category of weapons and hazards requiring specialized defense and response.

WMD.description: Nuclear, chemical, biological, and radiological weapons causing mass casualties.

IED.description: Homemade bomb constructed and deployed in unconventional ways.

JWOD.description: Law requiring government agencies to purchase specified supplies and services from AbilityOne.

AbilityOne.description: Federal program providing employment opportunities for people who are blind or have significant disabilities.

UNICOR.description: Government corporation employing federal inmates to produce goods and services.

GSA-PSHC.description: GSA service providing workspace solutions to federal agencies.

FAS.description: GSA service providing procurement solutions for federal agencies.

PBS.description: GSA organization managing federal buildings and providing workspace.

FEMP.description: DOE program helping federal agencies meet energy and sustainability goals.

DOE-NNSA.description: DOE agency responsible for maintaining the U.S. nuclear weapons stockpile.

ARPA-E.description: DOE agency funding high-potential, high-impact energy technologies.

EIA.description: DOE agency providing independent energy data, analysis, and forecasting.

FERC.description: Independent agency regulating interstate energy transmission and wholesale energy markets.

TVA.description: Government-owned corporation providing electricity generation and economic development.

FDIC.description: Independent agency insuring deposits at banks and thrift institutions.

FRB.description: Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the central bank of the United States.

OCC.full: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
OCC.description: Treasury bureau regulating and supervising national banks and federal savings associations.

CFPB.description: Agency protecting consumers from unfair financial practices.

SIGAR.full: Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction
SIGAR.description: Inspector general overseeing U.S. spending on Afghanistan reconstruction.

SIGIR.full: Special Inspector General for Iraq Reconstruction
SIGIR.description: Former inspector general overseeing U.S. spending on Iraq reconstruction.

CIGIE.full: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency
CIGIE.description: Council coordinating activities of federal inspectors general.

FITBIR.description: OMB tool providing transparency into federal IT investments and performance.

CPIC.description: Systematic approach to managing IT investments for maximum mission value.

TBM.description: Framework for managing IT costs and investments using industry-standard cost models.

OCIO.full: Office of the Chief Information Officer
OCIO.description: Agency office responsible for IT strategy, policy, and management.

DPC.description: EOP body coordinating domestic policy development and implementation.

CEA.description: EOP body advising the President on economic policy.

OVP.description: Executive office supporting the Vice President of the United States.

ONDCP.full: Office of National Drug Control Policy
ONDCP.description: EOP office coordinating national drug control policy.

OMB M-memo.description: Policy memoranda issued by OMB to heads of executive departments and agencies.

PIIA.description: Law requiring agencies to report on improper payments and take corrective actions.

IPIA.description: Former law requiring agencies to identify and reduce improper payments, superseded by PIIA.

WMATA.description: Transit authority operating Metrorail and Metrobus in the DC metro area.

FASAB.description: Board establishing accounting standards for the federal government.

FFMIA.description: Law requiring federal financial systems to comply with uniform standards.

DATA-Act2.full: Digital Accountability and Transparency Act of 2014
DATA-Act2.description: Law requiring standardized reporting of federal spending data.

DEIA.description: Federal workforce initiative promoting diverse and inclusive workplaces.

EEO.description: Principle ensuring fair treatment in employment regardless of protected characteristics.

ADR.description: Methods for resolving disputes outside of traditional litigation.

MPIN.description: Identifier assigned in SAM.gov for entity registration and management.

USACE.full: United States Army Corps of Engineers
USACE.description: Army command providing engineering services for public and military construction.

NAVFAC.description: Navy command delivering facilities engineering, public works, and environmental services.

SPAWAR.full: Space and Naval Warfare Systems Command
SPAWAR.description: Former Navy command for C4ISR systems, now NAVWAR.

PEO-STRI.full: Program Executive Office for Simulation, Training, and Instrumentation
PEO-STRI.description: Army PEO managing simulation and training systems.

AETC.description: Air Force command responsible for education and training of airmen.

AMC.description: Air Force command providing global airlift, air refueling, and aeromedical evacuation.

ACC.description: Air Force command providing combat-ready forces for air, space, and cyber operations.

TRADOC.description: Army command responsible for training soldiers and developing doctrine.

FORSCOM.description: Army command training and preparing conventional forces for deployment.

INSCOM.description: Army command providing intelligence, security, and information operations.

SMDC.description: Army command providing space and missile defense capabilities.

NSWC.description: Navy organization providing research, development, and testing for surface warfare.

ONR.description: Navy office funding science and technology research for naval capabilities.

AFRL.description: Air Force organization conducting science and technology research.

ARL.description: Army laboratory conducting fundamental and applied research for the Army.

NRL.description: Navy laboratory performing scientific research and advanced technology development.

LANL.description: DOE national laboratory focused on national security science and nuclear weapons.

LLNL.description: DOE national laboratory focused on national security and scientific discovery.

SNL.description: DOE national laboratory developing science-based technologies for national security.

ORNL.description: DOE national laboratory focused on energy, science, and national security.

PNNL.description: DOE national laboratory advancing science and technology for energy and security.

INL.description: DOE national laboratory focused on nuclear energy research and national security.

ANL.description: DOE national laboratory conducting multidisciplinary scientific research.

BNL.description: DOE national laboratory conducting research in nuclear and high-energy physics.

NREL.description: DOE national laboratory focused on renewable energy and energy efficiency research.

JPL.description: NASA research center conducting robotic space missions and Earth science.

APL.description: Johns Hopkins University research center supporting national security missions.

MITRE.description: Federally funded research and development center managing multiple FFRDCs.

RAND.description: Research organization providing analysis and solutions to public policy challenges.

IDA.description: FFRDC providing analyses of national security issues for the DOD.

CNA.description: Research organization serving as the Navy's FFRDC.

SEI.description: Carnegie Mellon FFRDC focused on software engineering and cybersecurity.

CMMI.description: Process improvement framework for software development and organizational maturity.

ITIL.description: Framework of best practices for IT service management.

ITSM.description: Strategic approach to designing, delivering, managing, and improving IT services.

PMBOK.description: PMI standard describing project management best practices and methodologies.

NIEM.description: Framework for sharing information across government, enabling data interoperability.

USMLE.description: Multi-step examination for medical licensure in the United States.

SNAP.description: USDA program providing nutrition assistance to eligible low-income individuals and families.

WIC.description: USDA supplemental nutrition program for pregnant women, new mothers, and young children.

TANF.description: HHS program providing temporary financial assistance and work opportunities.

CHIP.description: Program providing health coverage for uninsured children in families that earn too much for Medicaid.

SAMHSA.full: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
SAMHSA.description: HHS agency leading public health efforts for behavioral health.

HRSA.description: HHS agency improving health care access for underserved populations.

AHRQ.full: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality
AHRQ.description: HHS agency producing evidence to improve health care quality and safety.

ACF.description: HHS agency promoting economic and social well-being of families and children.

ACL.description: HHS agency supporting older adults and people with disabilities.

IHS.description: HHS agency providing health services to American Indians and Alaska Natives.

BIA.description: DOI bureau providing services to federally recognized tribes.

BOEM.description: DOI bureau managing development of offshore energy and mineral resources.

BSEE.full: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
BSEE.description: DOI bureau promoting safety and environmental protection in offshore operations.

BOR.description: DOI bureau managing water resources and hydroelectric power in the western U.S.

NHTSA.description: DOT agency responsible for motor vehicle and highway safety.

FHWA.description: DOT agency providing stewardship of the federal-aid highway program.

FRA.description: DOT agency regulating railroad safety and administering railroad programs.

FTA.description: DOT agency providing financial and technical assistance to local public transit systems.

MARAD.description: DOT agency promoting the U.S. maritime industry and maintaining national defense ships.

PHMSA.full: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration
PHMSA.description: DOT agency regulating the safe transportation of hazardous materials.

NTSB.description: Independent agency investigating transportation accidents and making safety recommendations.

CPSC.description: Independent agency protecting the public from unreasonable risks of injury from consumer products.

NLRB.description: Independent agency enforcing the National Labor Relations Act governing labor-management relations.

PBGC.description: Government corporation protecting private-sector defined benefit pension plans.

EXIM.full: Export-Import Bank of the United States
EXIM.description: Government corporation facilitating U.S. exports through financing and insurance.

OPIC.description: Former government corporation supporting private investment in developing countries, now DFC.

DFC.description: Government corporation providing finance for private development projects in lower-income countries.

MCC.description: Government corporation providing grants for economic growth in developing countries.

PC.description: Independent agency sending American volunteers to serve in communities worldwide.

CNCS.full: Corporation for National and Community Service
CNCS.description: Federal agency managing AmeriCorps and other domestic volunteer programs.

Amtrak.description: Government-supported corporation providing intercity passenger rail service.

USICH.full: United States Interagency Council on Homelessness
USICH.description: Federal agency coordinating the response to homelessness across government agencies.

FLETC.description: DHS agency providing law enforcement training for federal agencies.

SS.description: DHS agency protecting national leaders and investigating financial crimes.
